instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D7012: What is D7012? Diode between ground and gate of Q7010 on 2013-2015 year model macbook airs, necessary for Q7010 to allow PPDCIN_G3H to flow through to PP3V42_G3H power supply input. When this diode dies or corrodes, PP3V42_G3H input will not have any voltage, and chargers will not turn on. This can often be the problem if a system only works with a knockoff charger/bench power supply. .
definitions.PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H: What is PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H? PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H is the input voltage to the PP3V42_G3H buck converter circuit, it can be either charger voltage or battery voltage depending on what the system power source is. This often shorts to ground when one of the input capacitors dies. .

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A - Chai Late Damage - lost cause?
threads.message:
A client brought in a board heavily damaged by her chai late.

About 1cm of the board all the way along the top was submerged. 

I've US'd the board and cleaned it off so it looks nice and clean now. However we have no light on the charger and no life signs.

I suspect the circuit below is damaged and that <DIODE>D7012</DIODE> needs to be replaced as all the voltages before that point seem to match my good board. Somehow that area also had corrosion... But the majority of the liquid "was" on the other side of the board. 

Given the extent of the ingress is it worth proceeding or is it a waste of time?

[ATTACH type="full"]59320[/ATTACH]

[ATTACH type="full" width="406px"]59319[/ATTACH]

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A - Chai Late Damage - lost cause?
threads.message:
If you mean <CAPACITOR>C7012</CAPACITOR>, is not so important as schematic makes you think-
We need voltages to make an idea...

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A - Chai Late Damage - lost cause?
threads.message:
Hi

I mean <DIODE>D7012</DIODE>. 
I was cleaning off the corrosion and it broke in half, so now it's definitely a problem. I will attempt to replace and post back. 

PPCDV IN @R702 is 18.44v
DCIN ISOL GATE is 18.22v
PP18v5DCIN ISOL R
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H</SIGNAL> 0v

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A - Chai Late Damage - lost cause?
threads.message: <DIODE>D7012</DIODE> is very important; board cannot start if no good.
